description.narrative: The Department of Health and Social Care’s summary of expenditure on ODA is included in Annex E of the DHSC annual report and accounts.

title.narrative: National Institute for Health Research (NIHR) Annual Report 2017-18

description.narrative: National Institute for Health Research (NIHR) Annual Report 2017-18, including section on global health and ODA finances (pg 26-30)

title.narrative: DHSC official development assistance: what are we doing

description.narrative: DHSC ODA overview, covering ODA strategy and an overview of DHSC's ODA-funded programmes, country strategy (annex 1) and aid allocation strategy (annex 2)
DHSC's objectives and how it will deliver them to ensure the value, sustainability, accountability and management of public health services, including global health spend.
The UK government's allocation of ODA spending is set out in this spending review statement.

title.narrative: UK government public sector procurement policy

description.narrative: All DHSC ODA spend follows the UK government's public procurement policy

Procurement procedures are published along side all invitations to tender on the UK Government's Contracts Finder. This includes an explanation of the criteria on which decisions are made. The Procurement at DHSC page provides links and standard terms and conditions.

title.narrative: DHSC annual report and accounts: 2018 to 2019

description.narrative: Annual report and audited accounts showing how the department has funded its activities and used its resources during the financial year 2018 to 2019.

title.narrative: ICAI report on the UK aid response to global health threats

description.narrative: A review of the UK government's work on global health threats, including DHSC's £477m Global Health Security programme

title.narrative: UK 5-year action plan for antimicrobial resistance 2019 to 2024

description.narrative: Strategy document covering DHSC's work on anitmicrobial resistance both within the UK and overseas. The strategy includes ambitions and actions for the next 5 years, supporting the 20-year vision for antimicrobial resistance (AMR).

title.narrative: The UK government’s strategy for international development
